message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "We analyzed the survey data from World Bank Enterprise Surveys for the period 2010-2019, covering over 140,000 firms across 85 countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Competitiveness"]}, {"sentence": "Using monthly data from NASA's Global Land Data Assimilation System (GLDAS) and water level data from the Global Reservoir and Dam Database (GRanD), we investigated the relationship between reservoir water levels and terrestrial water storage.", "dataset": ["NASA's Global Land Data Assimilation System (GLDAS)", "Global Reservoir and Dam Database (GRanD)"], "topic": ["Water", "Environment"]}, {"sentence": "We utilized both human ratings and automatic speech recognition transcriptions of child language samples from the CHILDES database to examine the early syntax acquisition in children from bilingual families.", "dataset": ["CHILDES database"], "topic": ["Education", "Language"]}, {"sentence": "This study used regression analysis to investigate the factors that influence the happiness index calculated from the Gallup World Poll dataset, which covers more than 150 countries and territories worldwide.", "dataset": ["Gallup World Poll dataset"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity"]}, {"sentence": "We combined the training set of Stanford's Large Movie Review Dataset with an additional IMDb movie metadata dataset to improve sentiment classification accuracy.", "dataset": ["Stanford's Large Movie Review Dataset", "IMDb movie metadata dataset"], "topic": ["Digital Development"]}, {"sentence": "We compiled a new dataset combining information on household characteristics and assets from the Demographic and Health Surveys and the Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys to compare the distributional impact of cash transfers in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["Demographic and Health Surveys", "Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Social Protection"]}, {"sentence": "This paper investigated the impacts of trade agreement coverage depth, using data on preferential tariffs from the World Tariff Profiles dataset and the UNCTAD TRAINS database.", "dataset": ["World Tariff Profiles dataset", "UNCTAD TRAINS database"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "We used a panel dataset of over 1,000 banks across 114 countries from the BankScope database to investigate the effects of financial regulation on bank capital ratios.", "dataset": ["BankScope database"], "topic": ["Financial Sector"]}, {"sentence": "To compare the effectiveness of different HIV prevention interventions, we analyzed two complementary datasets: the Impact Evaluation of Combination HIV Prevention Programs implemented by the Tanzanian government and the Southern African Treatment and Prevention Study.", "dataset": ["Impact Evaluation of Combination HIV Prevention Programs", "Southern African Treatment and Prevention Study"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "Using survey data from the World Values Survey and the European Values Study, we examined the association between social trust and subjective well-being in 35 European countries.", "dataset": ["World Values Survey", "European Values Study"], "topic": ["Inequality and Shared Prosperity", "Social Sustainability and Inclusion"]}]
